definition: thin or slender/finely particulate/thin and soft/fine/delicate/trifling/(of a sound) quiet/frugal

sentences.english: Arrived on the bank, see have a lot of fine sand, use hop-pocket.
sentences.chinese: 到了岸上，看見有許多細沙，便用布袋。

sentences.english: She kept lifting handfuls of fine sand and letting it pour through her fingers.
sentences.chinese: 她不停捧起一手細沙，又讓它們順着手指流下去。

sentences.english: This soft sand forms the tropical beaches that we find so alluring.
sentences.chinese: 這些在細沙形成的熱帶沙灘讓我們覺得很迷人。

sentences.english: With windblown grit giving traction, the cyclists pedaled up to ten hours straight on the ice.
sentences.chinese: 騎車的人被風和細沙阻礙着在冰上直行了十個小時。

sentences.english: Winds pick up fine particles from the ground, and then the air becomes thick with dust.
sentences.chinese: 地面細沙被風捲起，空氣中便充滿厚厚灰塵。

sentences.english: He reached under the table and brought out a bucket of sand and started dumping it into the jar.
sentences.chinese: 然後他又伸手從桌下拉出一桶細沙並開始倒進瓶子裏。

sentences.english: Work the sand down into the existing soil using a garden rake.
sentences.chinese: 使用長柄耙將細沙和土壤完全混合。

sentences.english: The flow of sand in the hourglass like the never-discontinuous memories.
sentences.chinese: 沙漏裏流動的細沙，似是不肯間斷的回憶。

sentences.english: The waves still crash on the fine sand in front of the beach hotel.
sentences.chinese: 波浪依舊衝打着棕櫚灘酒店前的細沙。

sentences.english: Inkpots turned the book around and dusted the page with a bit of fine sand.
sentences.chinese: 墨水瓶轉過名冊，用點細沙拂過。

sentences.english: Little grains of sand can add up to a mountain over time.
sentences.chinese: 日積月累，要相信細沙也可以堆積成山。
細沙簇擁着我們的腳印。

definition: (bird species of China) grey heron (Ardea cinerea)
silvery light/bright white light/shining white light
water so clear you can see the bottom
clear as ice and clean as jade (idiom); spotless/irreproachable/incorruptible
